newsitem.title: USA: NYC Mayor to propose $33.5 bln FY 1998 budget.
newsitem.headline: NYC Mayor to propose $33.5 bln FY 1998 budget.

text.p: New York City Mayor Rudoph Giuliani on Thursday is expected to propose a $33.5 billion fiscal year 1998 budget, raising spending by about $626 million, according to budget documents.
Giuliani also is projecting that the city would profit handsomely from Wall Street's earnings, capturing the biggest ever suprlus of $856 million in fiscal 1997.
The mayor plans to unveil his proposed fiscal year 1998 executive budget, which begins July 1, at City Hall Thursday morning.

Giuliani, noting that his budget over the past four years had set a new direction by reducing spending and downsizing government, in prepared remarks, stated, "This budget reinvests much of our additional revenues in gap reductions and tax reform to stimulate economic growth and private sector job creation."
He added, "We will also spend wisely to meet the need of the city, to help our schools and to improve our quality of life.
